column3: Establishment of the first poorhouse in the American colonies
Widespread establishment of county poorhouses across the US
Involuntary commitment laws begin to emerge for the mentally ill
Dorothea Dix advocates for the reform of mental health care and better treatment of the mentally ill
Expansion of asylums and poorhouses as primary institutions for the mentally ill and impoverished
Peak of institutionalization in asylums and poorhouses, with many individuals committed involuntarily
Community Mental Health Act encourages deinstitutionalization and development of community-based care
Significant decline in the number of individuals committed to asylums due to reforms and changing attitudes towards mental health care
Continued emphasis on outpatient treatment and community support for individuals with mental illness, reducing reliance on institutionalization
